description: A pre- and Romano-British settlement. The site had a spring nearby with two wells that show evidence of votive deposits and associated structures, interpreted as a shrine.
bibliography: Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Dunkirt Barn, Abbotts Ann (Hampshire).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
Musty, J. “The Roman Pond and Dipping Well at Armsley, Godshill, Hampshire.” Proceedings of the Hampshire Field Club & Archaeological Society 30 (1973): 35–38.
Shortt, H de S. “A New Durotrigic Hoard from Godshill, Hampshire.” British Numismatic Journal 30 (1960): 1–5.
